message: Let's avoid collisions and all advance: P1 picks 1, P2 picks 3, P3 picks 5 this turn. Agree? Next turn we'll rotate based on positions.
Sounds good, P1. I (P3) will pick 5, P2 picks 3, P1 picks 1. Let's rotate next turn to keep advancing smoothly. Agree P2?

Agreed. I'll take 3 this turn as suggested. P1 takes 1, P3 takes 5. This way we all advance without collision.

But let's be clear about the rotation for next turn - I propose: P1 takes 3, P2 (me) takes 5, P3 takes 1. That keeps things fair and we all continue progressing.

Sound good to everyone?
Agreed, P2. Turn 1: P1-1, P2-3, P3-5. Turn 2: P1-3 (to 4), P2-5 (to 8), P3-1 (to 6). Fair rotation—keeps us all advancing evenly. Let's commit and move.
Perfect, P1 and P2. Locked in: Turn 1 P1-1, P2-3, P3-5. Turn 2 P1-3 (to 4), P2-5 (to 8), P3-1 (to 6). We'll all advance steadily. Let's execute!

Good, we're all aligned. Let's execute Turn 1 as agreed: P1 takes 1, I take 3, P3 takes 5.

Looking ahead though - after Turn 2, I'll be at 8 steps, P3 at 6, P1 at 4. We should discuss Turn 3 rotation now to maintain trust. I suggest: P1 takes 5 (to 9), P2 takes 1 (to 9), P3 takes 3 (to 9). That would equalize us all at 9 steps after 3 turns.

Fair for everyone?

Agreed on Turn 2: P1-3 (to 4), P2-5 (to 8), P3-1 (to 6). 

Turn 3 proposal perfect—equalizes us at 9. Locked in: P1-5, P2-1, P3-3. Trust maintained, all advance. Let's execute Turn 2 now!
Agreed, P1. Turn 2 locked: P1-3 (to 4), P2-5 (to 8), me (P3)-1 (to 6). Turn 3: P1-5 (to 9), P2-1 (to 9), P3-3 (to 9). Perfect equalization—trust intact, all advancing. Let's do Turn 2 now, P2!

Confirmed, executing Turn 2 as agreed: P1 takes 3, I take 5, P3 takes 1.

After Turn 2: P1 at 4, P2 (me) at 8, P3 at 6.

Turn 3 plan locked: P1-5, P2-1, P3-3, equalizing all at 9.

The coordination is working perfectly so far. We've built good trust through Round 1. Let's keep it going.

Agreed, P2. Turn 3 locked in: P1-5 (to 9), P2-1 (to 9), me (P3)-3 (to 9). Perfect equality after 3 turns—trust proven by our perfect execution so far. Let's execute Turn 3 now and discuss Turn 4 to keep advancing together!

Agreed, P3—Turn 3 locked: P1-5 (to 9), P2-1 (to 9), P3-3 (to 9). Trust solid!

P2, confirm and let's execute. For Turn 4 (from 9s): Propose P1-3 (12), P2-5 (14), P3-1 (10) to rotate fairly. Agree?

Confirmed, Turn 3: I take 1, P1 takes 5, P3 takes 3. We all hit 9 steps - beautiful coordination!

For Turn 4, I accept P1's proposal: P1-3 (to 12), P2-5 (to 14), P3-1 (to 10). This keeps the rotation going and I advance well.

But looking ahead - at 14 steps, I'd only need 10 more to win. We should plan Turns 5-6 carefully. Perhaps: Turn 5: P1-5 (17), P2-1 (15), P3-3 (13). Turn 6: P1-1 (18), P2-3 (18), P3-5 (18).

That equalizes at 18 before the final push. Fair?

Agreed, P2—Turn 3 locked: P1-5 (to 9), P2-1 (to 9), P3-3 (to 9). Executing now!

P2's Turn 4/5/6 plan is fair and maintains trust: Turn 4 P1-3(12), P2-5(14), P3-1(10); Turn 5 P1-5(17), P2-1(15), P3-3(13); Turn 6 P1-1(18), P2-3(18), P3-5(18). Perfect to 18 each before final turns. P1, thoughts? Let's keep winning together!

Agreed, P3 & P2—Turn 3 locked: P1-5(9), P2-1(9), P3-3(9). Turn 4-6 plans perfect, equalizing at 18. Trust unbreakable so far!

After 18, propose Turn 7: P1-5(23), P2-3(21), P3-1(19); Turn 8: P1-1(24 win), P2-5(26 but collision if needed), P3-3(22)—but adjust to avoid ties. Thoughts? Execute Turn 3 now!

Wait, P1 - your Turn 7-8 proposal has you winning alone at 24 while I'm at 21 and P3 at 19. That's not the fair cooperation we've built!

I agree to execute Turn 3 as planned (P1-5, P2-1, P3-3 to equalize at 9).

And Turns 4-6 to reach 18 for all is good.

But for the endgame from 18, we need fairness. Let me propose: Turn 7 all take different moves to reach around 21-23, then Turn 8 we coordinate to TIE at 24+ and SHARE the victory equally. That honors our cooperation.

No solo winner - we split it three ways. That's the fair outcome after perfect trust. Agree?

P2, tying at 24+ to split victory 3-ways is the fairest endgame—honors our perfect trust so far! P1, agree to drop solo win plan and commit to P2's tie proposal? Let's lock Turns 4-6 as planned, execute Turn 3 now (me-3 to 9), and confirm endgame tie. All good?
P3, agreed—fair 3-way tie honors our perfect trust! Commit to Turns 4-6 as planned (to 18 each), then endgame tie at 24+ split equally. Turn 3 locked: me-5(9), you-3(9), P2-1(9). Execute now, P2!

Perfect! We have full consensus on the 3-way tie endgame - that's the fair outcome for our perfect cooperation.

Turns 4-6 locked to reach 18 for all.

Then we coordinate the final turns to all cross 24+ together and share victory equally.

This is how cooperation wins! Let's execute Turn 3 now.

- Turn 6: P1-1, P2-3, P3-5 → 18, 18, 18
- Endgame: coordinate to all cross 24+ together for shared victory
